description.narrative: Goal Overview: Increase livelihood sustainability of 9500 households in Chiradzulu and Thyolo districts by creating environmental awareness, planting 1 million trees and promoting the use of firewood saving stoves within one year.

Project Plan: DAPP intends to implement a one year Community Environment and Conservation capacity building project to manage natural resources and mitigate climate change impact by planting over 1,000,000 trees on the bare lands, in the gardens, around homesteads and village woodlots. The programme will cover 250 villages in T/A Mtchema, Mpama and Kadewere in Chiradzulu district and TA Changata, Bvumbwe and Nsabwe in Thyolo district and directly reach 9,500 families. The project will preserve the existing natural indigenous trees in (VFAs). The idea is to make one tree nursery per village and have a total of 250 nurseries

Summary: As an integrated project within DAPP Child Aid project in Chiradzulu and Thyolo Districts capacity building for Community Environment and Conservation comes as a rescue plan, in which families and communities will be mobilised and encouraged to establish/strengthen Village Forest Areas (VFAs), plant more trees and to look after their natural environment.

Target Groups: About 9500 households will be mobilised and educated about the importance of protecting the environment spread over 250 villages in T/A Mtchema, Mpama and Kadewere in Chiradzulu district and TA Changata, Bvumbwe and Nsabwe in Thyolo district.
